info.name: Codeable Beta Dashboard
info.description: I did this slight re-styling of the Beta dashboard to improve readability and user experience for me. The design is so nice I didn't want to do much to it, but I wanted non-essential stuff to be more compact.
info.additionalInfo:
These are the changes I made:

- Darker, slightly larger, font in the main column for easier readability. Changed line heights too to take up less space.
- More compact left and right column. Removed a few elements that I didn't need
- Attachments list is now a scroll box. (I had a client who makes good use of attachment, we are well over 60 now). A long list creates a long-scrolling page. It doesn't need to be, a scroll box is better. The only downside here is that the add attachment button is at the bottom. You still have to scroll down to get to it.
- Smaller header height to fit more content on the screen.
- Wider main column. This is where all the action is, shouldn't it be the focus of the design?
- Wider overlay for the popup element.

- Less Scrolling. One of the main things I wanted to fix was the scroll-within-scroll. It is something that I do not think is a good UX. It is something that requires being aware of your mouse position before scrolling, if the page was too long because the attachments list was long, then you could scroll the message area right off the screen while you are reading. This change fixes that, the surrounding structural elements are all locked on the page and the only scrolling elements are the message area and the attachments list.No more wild scrolling.

The defined heights for some of the elements are tuned to my laptop screen where I do most of my interaction with the Codeable site. You may need to adjust some of the heights for your own screen to make the most of your real estate.
